post.body: Hello ZeroMe!

Can you imagine: A non profit organization that deals with encryption and digital signatures asks for donations. They accept credit cards and PayPal, but no BitCoins or other crypto currencies. And that is in 2017. If you don't believe that such an organization could exist, check this out: https://letsencrypt.org/donate/

So excited...

I did a hike and fly today. Together with a friend we hiked and climbed the Small Mythen. When we just arrived at the summit the fog came. We thought we couldn't fly and started descending. Halfway down, the fog lifted, so we went up again. The flight was marvelous, gliding into the sunset...

http://www.20min.ch/panorama/news/story/30281652

I finally started refurbishing my paragliding website. Since I want to host it on the Internet as well as on zeronet, I am using one of the static generators from  https://www.staticgen.com/. I chose hugo as it seems to be fairly new and I could install it with apt-get. 
After some trial and error, I managed to get the URLs and links behaving. But the carousel doesn't load in zeronet. It works perfectly when using the hugo server.
The site is at: [paraeasy.bit](/paraeasy.bit)
Also, I have the impression it tries to fetch stuff from the Internet even though it is supposed to be static.

Just wondering if it would be feasible to distribute this hash list with zeronet, and check the filter before displaying a pic. 
http://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2016/10/internet-watch-foundation-child-sex-abuse-org-urges-hash-list/
Could be a preemptive measure before the platform might be attacked by totalitarians with false accusations.
In case the list was abused for censorship, the filter could be relaxed again.

No surprise when you consider who owns linkedin.
https://thestack.com/security/2016/10/06/linkedin-accesses-gmail-contacts-via-auto-authorization/

Does somebody here have experience in packaging python projects? I would like to package zeronet for debian. But usually I take the python stuff directly from pypi, and they have working distutils setup.py files. 
I tried to create a setup.py file myself, but the resulting package is missing lots of source files. 
https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/417

comment.body: Ah, now that you mention it, that makes sense. But still it would be cool if there was a way. Even if that meant having the thumbnail in zeronet.
Yes, the original post disappeared after some syncing. I didn't know how to bring it back.
Are you talking about OpenWRT based images such as freifunk with OLSRD or BATMAN routing? Or is this about something different?
What's the source of this frustration?

Wow, you're having a bad day. But at the end of every rain, the sun comes out again. I know that sounds stupid when you're down. Just go for a walk in the woods or mountains, or whatever it is what makes you happy again.
I'm totally happy with Rhythmbox

@Icf20: So you'd prefer if the seller of your car could go to a corrupt policeman and tell him that he didn't sell it, but you stole it? I don't think giving control to a central entity to edit the history is the solution. One possible solution might be to register the property also on the blockchain. E.g. with a colored coin.

@Icf20: A judge can order the seizure of your income, but a judge can also be wrong. So it is good that there exists some property that nobody can take away from you. In general, people are better off in countries that respect their citizen's property rights. What is the point in saving, if you can't be sure if it's seized in the future?

@Icf20: If the employee and employer are within the jurisdiction of the court, the salary can be rerouted to some arbitrator even if it's BitCoins. There are lots of cases where robbers of diamonds or whatever hide the treasure somewhere to pick up after release from prison. Society generally accepts a certain level of criminal misbehavior, because living in a totalitarian dystopia where everybody snoops at their neighbor would be much worse. Bruce Schneier describes this delicate balance very well in his book "Liars & Outliers"

@Icf20: To say the colonists have a better claim on the land of the natives, is like saying the Nazis had a better claim on the Gold of the Jews. And that Erdogan has a better claim on the money of people who favor other politics.
@Icf20: So, to whom would you want to give the golden keys of your backdoor? To the indians or to the colonialists which ruled at the time and had judges?
@Planteater @Icf20 : And if there was a blockchain back then, A could not have stolen from B.

@Smuntroleum: Why would it have to run on ZeroNet? OpenBazaar is distributed. I'm sure they have good reasons for the design choices they made. For example the escrow and dispute resolution systems could be quite hard to implement with ZeroNet.

@Smuntroleum: Ah yes that's true. They did that on purpose to dicurage trading of illicit goods. They don't want to become the next silk road. And I think this will help them to become the next ebay and amazon.
@Smuntroleum: corrected in OpenBazaar. It will take a moment for bazaarbay to refresh. Thanks for reporting.

@Dergatt: Yes, the closed drivers are a big problem. That's why every phone you can buy with an open OS is great. In case of apps an usability, my aquaris is way better than the OpenMoko I had a while back.

@5thzhino: I used the standard splitter contract in Mist. But the problem is probably because the environment where I want to work with ETC was switched to ETC after I also used it with ETH. So, I'm rebuilding the blockchain without fork in a separate environment now.
@5thzhino: This has a fee. I managed to initialize a geth instance with the full classic blockchain, and move the ETC.

@ks: It seems to be dead among the bitcoin and libertarian people. But some Banks apparently want to use it. With these centrally controlled stuff it's hard to say from the outside of there was real interest, or if they just increased the supply. I might be wrong, don't known how much they can manipulate.
@ks: I don't touch both of them. Sold my 30$ worth of Ripple years ago.
The zite owner has to enable the newer id providers manually.

@Durand: Scrolling only works on some applications. I didn't start up blender yet on that machine. I will definitively have a try in the next few days. It's a pity that the 3D CAD that I'm developing for doesn't run on any decent OS.

@Durand: Cool! Thanks for the hint with the relative URLs.

It looks different now. The css is loaded, but the carousel still wont.

The carousel works if I right click -> this frame -> show only this frame. 
Is zeronet interfering with some functionality of the site?

Also, the contact form doesn't work for me. How do you handle the contacts form when you host a hugo site on zeronet?
Yes, namecoin should really be used more. It seems to me that not a lot has happened with namecoin in the last two years. Appart from zeronet OFC.
@Zero: I didn't find it in the ubuntu repo. What are the advantages? Does it also work well for product pages?

A year or so ago, I read an article about a guy who placed an invisible linkedin widget on his page. That enabled him to know every visitor who was logged into linkedin on the same browser. Since then I usually log out from most services immediately after I'm done.
@ks: PKGBUILD contains the following comment: # There is no setup.py shipped, so brute-force copy
